page.title: 08The Civic Centre in Alsager
page.content: The Civic Centres doors were opened at Christmas in 1972 but there was an opening ball in December 1972.There was originally only a hall and kitchen but in March 1974 a bar lounge was opened.Originally it was run by a management committee but now it is run by the council.Anyone can hire the centre and it is extensivly used.There is a lunch club for O.A.Ps on Tuesday and Thursdays where 52 can be seated. The centre who does a meals on wheels. It is also used for wedding receptions,jumble sales,keep fit, T.W.G.,coffee mornings,fairs etc.The Alsager Community Theatre regulary performs plays.Their last performance was "The Crucible".There is a large car park at the rear of the centre which provides the town with ample free parking.The Centre forms a central part of village life.
